channel.title: Edit Appearance of Anvils
channel.description:
Hello!
I was trying to find the sprite/images for anvils today and haven't had any luck. I thought maybe it was in the sprites.rscd because it is viewed from different angles but didn't see it there. The other files seem to be xml files. Does anyone know where I might find this? I am open to suggestions even if you can't confirm.
Thanks! mdttheory

item.title: Edit Appearance of Anvils
item.dc:creator: @mdttheory mdttheory
item.description:
@mdttheory wrote:

Sorry, but that doesn’t make any sense. My understanding now is that object models are in a models file in the game cache. The look of the models are not dictated by the xml file. The xml file simply provides information about a particular model.

At this point I need to figure out how to decompress this models36.jag file.

Read full topic

item.title: Edit Appearance of Anvils
item.dc:creator: @Artemis_Wp Artemis Wp
item.description:
@Artemis_Wp wrote:

Nope, you need to decompress Objects.rscd and edit it. The .xml one is SERVER part and .rscd is CLIENT part. Both files needs to have same lines. You can simply edit/work on .xml one then copy entire code and paste on decompressed .rscd one.

Read full topic

item.title: Edit Appearance of Anvils
item.dc:creator: @mdttheory mdttheory
item.description:
@mdttheory wrote:

Objects.xml is decompressed from Objects.rscd. Also, there is no ID listed in objects.xml. Lastly, how do you find the anvil model so you can edit it?

Read full topic

item.title: Edit Appearance of Anvils
item.dc:creator: @xAdyx xAdyx
item.description:
@xAdyx wrote:

[quote=“mdttheory, post:3, topic:545291”]Yeah, I found it in the objects.xml which as unpacked from objects.rscd.

-<GameObjectDef> <name>anvil</name> <description>heavy metal</description> <command1>WalkTo</command1> <command2>Examine</command2> <type>1</type> <width>1</width> <height>1</height> <groundItemVar>0</groundItemVar> <objectModel>anvil</objectModel> </GameObjectDef>

It also has an ID of 50.

Is there more to the objects.rscd file than the xml code?[/quote]

Objects.rscd & objects.xlm needs to have same codes and IDs otherwise ur client will crash.

Read full topic

item.title: Edit Appearance of Anvils
item.dc:creator: @mdttheory mdttheory
item.description:
@mdttheory wrote:

Yeah, I found it in the objects.xml which as unpacked from objects.rscd.

-<GameObjectDef> <name>anvil</name> <description>heavy metal</description> <command1>WalkTo</command1> <command2>Examine</command2> <type>1</type> <width>1</width> <height>1</height> <groundItemVar>0</groundItemVar> <objectModel>anvil</objectModel> </GameObjectDef>

It also has an ID of 50.

Is there more to the objects.rscd file than the xml code?

Read full topic

item.title: Edit Appearance of Anvils
item.dc:creator: @stEps stEps
item.description:
@stEps wrote:

it is an object. find the id and find it.

Read full topic
